sentences.sContent: Manning hoped to acquire valuable works of art as cheaply as possible.
sentences.sCn: 曼宁希望以尽可能低的价格买到有价值的艺术品。

sentences.sContent: She has acquired an email address and a site on the World Wide Web.
sentences.sCn: 她获得了一个电子邮件地址和万维网网址。

sentences.sContent: ...and many were eager to acquire examples of Greco-Roman and Italian art for their own collections...
...it is good for the whole society because if more people in this society can choose to acquire scientific knowledge...
...Some believe that it is a better choice to acquire knowledge in science...
...but others consider it better to acquire knowledge in science...
...which will help us acquire new knowledge constantly...
...this saying delivers the message that if we want to truly acquire knowledge...
...But people must acquire this skill somewhere...
...acquire a base of factual knowledge in any domain in which you want to perform well...

remMethod.val: ac ＋ quire(追求) → 不断寻求才能够获得 → 获得

words.tran: [医] 后天的；已获得的；已成习惯的

trans.tranCn: 取得， 获得； 学到
trans.tranOther: to obtain something by buying it or being given it
